comments:
After I changed the sourcepath of some entries in my projectfile .project, I
couldn't open the project anymore.
The syntax seems correct to me and the errormessage is meaningless.
In any case, even when some syntax error does exist, the errormessage should be
more accurate.

Created an attachment (id=28802)
Error message when opening the project
Moving to Platform Resources for comment

Is there more information in the error log file? (workspace/.metadata/.log)  The
.project file should not be edited by hand, it is a machine generated file for
storing project metadata.

Yep, apparently the "Document root element is missing"
Might this have been because the file was saved as text and not UTF-8 ?

I noticed the .project file has a UTF-8 byte order mark. Did you edit it with
Notepad and aved as Unicode? The XML parser you are using (Crimson) chokes with
them. IIRC, Xerces (the XML parser in IBM JDKs/JREs and in Sun's JDK 1.5.*)
would handle it properly.

I altered the file using UltraEdit.
It's not unlikely its original format was changed ... .
From previous XLM Java coding, I seem to recall a similar text/UTF error.
Pretty stupid kind of problem.
How would this be best dealt with ?

That explains it - thanks Rafael.

Solution: don't edit the .project file by hand.

To revert this, you have to open the .project file and save it back using an
ordinary encoding (Cp1252, default for Windows in English). Notepad will do the
trick, for instance. Open it, and Save as... with the same name but change the
encoding to be Ansi.
